AssociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to associate security groups with Tencent Cloud resources in batches.
AssociateSecurityGroups.name: Associates security groups in batches

CloneAccount.document: This API is used to clone an instance account.
CloneAccount.name: Clones an instance account

CloseDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to disable public network access for a TencentDB instance, which will make the public IP address inaccessible. The `DescribeDCDBInstances` API will not return the public domain name and port information of the corresponding instance.
CloseDBExtranetAccess.name: Disables public network access

CopyAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to copy the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts. Permissions can only be copied between accounts with the same `Readonly` attribute.
CopyAccountPrivileges.name: Copies account permissions

CreateAccount.document: This API is used to create a TencentDB account. Multiple accounts can be created for one instance. Accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
CreateAccount.name: Creates an account

DeleteAccount.document: This API is used to delete a TencentDB account, which is uniquely identified by username and host.
DeleteAccount.name: Deletes an account

DescribeAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to query the permissions of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
DescribeAccountPrivileges.name: Queries account permissions

DescribeAccounts.document: This API is used to query the list of accounts of a specified TencentDB instance.
DescribeAccounts.name: Queries the list of accounts

DescribeDBLogFiles.document: This API is used to get the list of various logs of a database, including cold backups, binlogs, errlogs, and slowlogs.
DescribeDBLogFiles.name: Gets the list of logs

DescribeDBParameters.document: This API is used to get the current parameter settings of a database.
DescribeDBParameters.name: Views database parameters

DescribeDBSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of an instance.
DescribeDBSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of an instance

DescribeDBSyncMode.document: This API is used to query the sync mode of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDBSyncMode.name: Queries the sync mode

DescribeDCDBInstances.document:
This API is used to query the list of TencentDB instances. It supports filtering instances by project ID, instance ID, private network address, and instance name.
If no filter is specified, 10 instances will be returned by default. Up to 100 instances can be returned for a single request.
DescribeDCDBInstances.name: Queries the list of instances

DescribeDCDBShards.document: This API is used to query the information of shards of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDCDBShards.name: Queries shard information

DescribeDatabaseObjects.document: This API is used to query the list of database objects in a TencentDB instance, including tables, stored procedures, views, and functions.
DescribeDatabaseObjects.name: Queries the list of database objects

DescribeDatabaseTable.document: This API is used to query the table information of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabaseTable.name: Queries table information

DescribeDatabases.document: This API is used to query the list of databases of a TencentDB instance.
DescribeDatabases.name: Queries the list of databases

DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to query the security group details of a project.
DescribeProjectSecurityGroups.name: Queries the security group details of a project

DescribeProjects.document: This API is used to query the project list.
DescribeProjects.name: Queries the project list

DisassociateSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to unassociate security groups from instances in batches.
DisassociateSecurityGroups.name: Unassociates security groups in batches

GrantAccountPrivileges.document:
This API is used to grant permissions to a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
GrantAccountPrivileges.name: Sets account permissions

InitDCDBInstances.document: This API is used to initialize instances, including setting the default character set and table name case sensitivity.
InitDCDBInstances.name: Initializes instances

ModifyAccountDescription.document:
This API is used to modify the remarks of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ModifyAccountDescription.name: Modifies account remarks

ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.document: This API is used to modify the security groups associated with TencentDB.
ModifyDBInstanceSecurityGroups.name: Modifies the security groups associated with TencentDB

ModifyDBInstancesProject.document: This API is used to modify the project to which TencentDB instances belong.
ModifyDBInstancesProject.name: Modifies the project to which instances belong

ModifyDBParameters.document: This API is used to modify database parameters.
ModifyDBParameters.name: Modifies database parameters

ModifyDBSyncMode.document: This API is used to modify the sync mode of a TencentDB instance.
ModifyDBSyncMode.name: Modifies the sync mode

OpenDBExtranetAccess.document: This API is used to enable public network access for a TencentDB instance. After that, you can access the instance with the public domain name and port obtained through the `DescribeDCDBInstances` API.
OpenDBExtranetAccess.name: Enables public network access

ResetAccountPassword.document:
This API is used to reset the password of a TencentDB account.
Note: accounts with the same username but different hosts are different accounts.
ResetAccountPassword.name: Resets account password

members.document: Account password, which can contain 6-32 letters, digits, and common symbols but not semicolons, single quotation marks, and double quotation marks.

members.document: Whether to create a read-only account. 0: no; 1: for the account's SQL requests, the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the primary will be used; 2: the secondary will be used first, and if it is unavailable, the operation will fail; 3: only the secondary will be read from.
members.name: ReadOnly

members.document: Account remarks, which can contain 0-256 letters, digits, and common symbols.
members.name: Description

members.document:
If the secondary delay exceeds the set value of this parameter, the secondary will be deemed to have failed.
It is recommended that this parameter be set to a value greater than 10. This parameter takes effect when `ReadOnly` is 1 or 2.
members.name: DelayThresh

members.document:
If the secondary delay exceeds the set value of this parameter, the secondary will be deemed to have failed.
It is recommended that this parameter be set to a value greater than 10. This parameter takes effect when `ReadOnly` is 1 or 2.

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is table, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty

members.document:
Global permission. Valid values: SELECT; INSERT; UPDATE; DELETE; CREATE; DROP; REFERENCES; INDEX; ALTER; CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES; LOCK TABLES; EXECUTE; CREATE VIEW; SHOW VIEW; CREATE ROUTINE; ALTER ROUTINE; EVENT; TRIGGER; SHOW DATABASES 
Database permission. Valid values: SELECT; INSERT; UPDATE; DELETE; CREATE; DROP; REFERENCES; INDEX; ALTER; CREATE TEMPORARY TABLES; LOCK TABLES; EXECUTE; CREATE VIEW; SHOW VIEW; CREATE ROUTINE; ALTER ROUTINE; EVENT; TRIGGER 
Table/view permission. Valid values: SELECT; INSERT; UPDATE; DELETE; CREATE; DROP; REFERENCES; INDEX; ALTER; CREATE VIEW; SHOW VIEW; TRIGGER 
Stored procedure/function permission. Valid values: ALTER ROUTINE; EXECUTE 
Field permission. Valid values: INSERT; REFERENCES; SELECT; UPDATE
members.name: Privileges

members.document: Type. Valid values: table; view; proc; func; \*. If `DbName` is a specific database name and `Type` is `\*`, the permissions of the database will be set (i.e., `db.\*`), in which case the `Object` parameter will be ignored
members.name: Type

members.document: Type name. For example, if `Type` is table, `Object` indicates a specific table name; if both `DbName` and `Type` are specific names, it indicates a specific object name and cannot be `\*` or empty
members.name: Object

members.document: If `Type` = table and `ColName` is `\*`, the permissions will be granted to the table; if `ColName` is a specific field name, the permissions will be granted to the field
members.name: ColName

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: List of IDs of instances to be initialized. The ID is in the format of `dcdbt-ow728lmc` and can be obtained through the `DescribeDCDBInstances` API.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: List of parameters. Valid values: character_set_server (character set; required); lower_case_table_names (table name case sensitivity; required; 0: case-sensitive; 1: case-insensitive); innodb_page_size (InnoDB data page; default size: 16 KB); sync_mode (sync mode; 0: async; 1: strong sync; 2: downgradable strong sync; default value: strong sync).
members.name: Params

members.document: Async task ID. The task status can be queried through the `DescribeFlow` API.
members.name: FlowIds

members.document: Passed through from the input parameters.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Last modified time of a log
members.name: Mtime

members.document: File length
members.name: Length

members.document: Uniform resource identifier (URI) used during log download
members.name: Uri

members.document: Filename
members.name: FileName

members.document: Instance ID in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Access host allowed for a user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: New account remarks, which can contain 0-256 characters.
members.name: Description

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Database engine name. Valid value: `dcdb`.
members.name: Product

members.document: Instance ID
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: List of IDs of security groups to be modified, which is an array of one or more security group IDs.
members.name: SecurityGroupIds

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: List of IDs of instances to be modified. Instance ID is in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: ID of the project to be assigned, which can be obtained through the `DescribeProjects` API.
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Instance ID in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: List of parameters. Every element is a combination of `Param` and `Value`.
members.name: Params

members.document: Instance ID in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Parameter modification results
members.name: Result

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: ID of an instance for which to modify the sync mode. The ID is in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Sync mode. 0: async; 1: strong sync; 2: downgradable strong sync
members.name: SyncMode

members.document: Async task ID. The task status can be queried through the `DescribeFlow` API.
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: ID of an instance for which to enable public network access. The ID is in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Whether IPv6 is used. Default value: 0
members.name: Ipv6Flag

members.document: Async task ID. The task status can be queried through the `DescribeFlow` API.
members.name: FlowId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Constraint type, such as enum and section
members.name: Type

members.document: List of valid values when constraint type is `enum`
members.name: Enum

members.document:
Range when constraint type is `section`
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Range

members.document: List of valid values when constraint type is `string`
members.name: String

members.document: Parameter name
members.name: Param

members.document: Current parameter value
members.name: Value

members.document:
Previously set value, which is the same as `value` after the parameter takes effect. If no value has been set, this field will not be returned.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SetValue

members.document: Default value
members.name: Default

members.document: Parameter constraint
members.name: Constraint

members.document: Whether a value has been set. false: no, true: yes
members.name: HaveSetValue

members.document: Renames a parameter
members.name: Param

members.document: Result of parameter modification. 0: success; -1: failure; -2: invalid parameter value
members.name: Code

members.document: Project ID
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: The `uin` of the resource owner (root account)
members.name: OwnerUin

members.document: Application ID
members.name: AppId

members.document: Project name
members.name: Name

members.document: Creator `uin`
members.name: CreatorUin

members.document: Source platform
members.name: SrcPlat

members.document: Source `AppId`
members.name: SrcAppId

members.document: Project status. 0: normal; -1: disabled; 3: default project.
members.name: Status

members.document: Creation time
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Whether it is the default project. 1: yes; 0: no.
members.name: IsDefault

members.document: Description
members.name: Info

members.document: Instance ID in the format of dcdbt-ow728lmc.
members.name: InstanceId

members.document: Login username.
members.name: UserName

members.document: Access host allowed for a user. An account is uniquely identified by username and host.
members.name: Host

members.document: New password, which can contain 6-32 letters, digits, and common symbols but not semicolons, single quotation marks, and double quotation marks.
members.name: Password

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Project ID
members.name: ProjectId

members.document: Creation time in the format of yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Security group ID
members.name: SecurityGroupId

members.document: Security group name
members.name: SecurityGroupName

members.document: Security group remarks
members.name: SecurityGroupRemark

members.document: Inbound rule
members.name: Inbound

members.document: Outbound rule
members.name: Outbound

members.document: Policy, which can be `ACCEPT` or `DROP`
members.name: Action

members.document: Source IP or source IP range, such as 192.168.0.0/16
members.name: CidrIp

members.document: Port
members.name: PortRange

members.document: Network protocol. UDP and TCP are supported.
members.name: IpProtocol

members.document: Shard ID
members.name: ShardInstanceId

members.document: Shard set ID
members.name: ShardSerialId

members.document: Status. 0: creating; 1: processing; 2: running; 3: shard not initialized; -2: shard deleted
members.name: Status

members.document: Creation time
members.name: Createtime

members.document: Memory size in GB
members.name: Memory

members.document: Storage capacity in GB
members.name: Storage

members.document: Numeric ID of a shard
members.name: ShardId

members.document: Number of nodes. 2: one primary and one secondary; 3: one primary and two secondaries
members.name: NodeCount

members.document: Product type ID (this field is obsolete and should not be depended on)
members.name: Pid

members.document: Number of CPU cores
members.name: Cpu

members.document: Column name
members.name: Col

members.document: Column type
members.name: Type
